0.title: THE PERIODIC TABLE
clues: It's right up in the pole position on the periodic table, atomic number 1
Alphabetically, it's the first of the noble gases
Don't take this the wrong way:  it's the most used & cheapest  metal
Decompression sickness, AKA the bends, is characterized by the formation of bubbles of this gas in the blood
DAILY DOUBLE
The last element in the table that occurs widely in nature, it was named for a planet discovered 8 years before

1.title: O POURI
clues: Though spelled differently than her BFF, Ms. King, this is Oprah's middle name
Oprah flew an entire audience to this city for a tour, including a run up the "rocky" steps of the Museum of Art
Oprah was an executive producer of this 2009 film that earned Mo'nique an Oscar
Calling it "her proudest day", in 2007 Oprah opened a school for impoverished girls in this country
(Oprah sits in her usual chair)This autobiography by Maya Angelou was the first book I ever read that made me feel my life as a colored girl growing up in Mississippi deserved validation

2.title: ON THE LAMB
clues: Musso & Frank Grill in Hollywood serves roast lamb with this traditional jelly accompaniment
"The Good Housekeeping Cookbook" says to garnish lamb with broiled halves of pears or this fuzzy fruit
Berkeley's Chez Panisse serves rack of lamb with this traditional Mexican sauce; the olives are an unusual touch
The "New York Times Cook Book" offers a "Bengal" recipe for lamb flavored with this kind of powder
New York's Le Cirque serves rack of lamb with eggplant & this cheese whose name means "recooked"

The name of a marsupial pal of Winnie-the Pooh

A formal order from a king or a judge

4.title: APP-Y DAYS

6.title: HISTORY & GEOGRAPHY
clues: As a result of the 1967 Arab-Israel War, Israel took control of this disputed piece of land along the Mediterranean

(Kelly of the Clue Crew shows a map on the monitor.)  Stretching from the Taurus Mountains in the north to the Persian Gulf in the south, with its heart between the Tigris and Euphrates rivers, is this ancient region, home to the world's first cities
DAILY DOUBLE
An anagram of the present-day capital, this city was the capital of Japan from 794 to 1868

(Sarah of the Clue Crew shows a map on the monitor.)  Germany's 1939 invasion of Poland was due largely to friction over a strip of land called the Polish Corridor; it was taken from Germany and awarded to Poland by the Versailles Treaty, giving Poland direct access to this sea
In 1999, 400 years after establishing a permanent settlement there, Portugal returned this overseas territory to China

8.title: GOING FOR BAROQUE
clues: King George II began the tradition of rising when hearing this chorus in Handel's "Messiah"

While staying with his brother Johann Christoph, he learned to play & repair organs
DAILY DOUBLE

This 4-syllable word refers to the substitute who learns a role in case the lead actor can't perform
